page.title: 09Chapels
page.content: There are six{places of worship}in {Nantyffyllon.}One{church,}four{chapels and one{Kingdom hall.}Of the four chapels, Salem is{Welsh Baptist, Siloh and Saron are Welsh {congregragational}and Trinty is {presbyterian.}St. Peters church shares a vicar with the church at Caerau Siloh shares a minister with a chapel in Caerau while the other chapels rely on visiting ministers. Services average two each Sunday with St.Peters, Salem and Trinty also having Sunday schools. The chapels are all very large buildings which were constructed during the later part of the 19th century. All are in a good state of repair but are very expensive to maintain. A 98 year old tenor bell summons parishioners to services at St.Peters. St.Peters also has some beautiful stained glass windows.
